views.markdown:
Compatible with iOS 8, 9, 10 and 11

"TextSearchPro" is Tweak which can search for a text easily using via Flipswitch or CCsupport and ActionMenu.

You can search for WebView (WKWebView) immediately from a home screen and on the application.

Search Engine:
- Google
- Bing
- Yahoo!
- Yahoo!Japan
- Baidu
- Define
(iOS built-in dictionary)

Use the "Custom" function also supports various search.
- Support: Application's URL Scheme

Note: Media Player (like video) link is not supported. iOS 8.2 or less can key input only Portrait.

Please use at FlipControlCenter, Activator, CCSupport and etc...

Since ActionMenu is not Depends, if you want to use, please install separately.
- ActionMenu Support browser:Safari/Chrome

For iOS 11.x user: CCSupport is not Depends, please install separately.

Configure options from Settings app.

v1.1.3 Fixed: Issues with freeze on 3D Touch or action sheet due to long press on iOS 11 or higher (The operation by long press is disabled on iOS 11 or higher) v1.1.2
Support: iOS 8 to 11.3.1
Added: ControlCneter toggle
(Please install CCSupport)
v1.1.1
Support: iOS 10.3.x
v1.1.0
Support: iOS 10

v1.0.7
Support: iOS 9.2 - 9.3.x (already)
Fix: Minor Issue
v1.0.6
Add: Dark Keyboard
- To use the dark keyboard at the time of the search pop-up.

Add: No dim LockScreen
- No dim the screen when used in the LockScreen.

v1.0.5
Add: If a Passcode is on, it can't be run on Lock screen.
v1.0.4
This version's main function is Action Menu support at "WebView on the screen".

v1.0.3
Added: Close window by App Redirect
Support: AppStore Link
(In Default is disabled.)
v1.0.2
[WKWebView]
Added: Scroll to Top button
Added: Page loading progress-bar
Added: Pull to refresh
Remove: Reload button

When the Window is open, it was so as not to display the NC and CC.

Support: iOS 8
Note: iOS 8.2 or less can key input only Portrait.

v1.0.1
Added: Custom URL 3
Support: Application's URL Scheme
(Custom URL)
Added: Action Menu add-on for TextSearch
(Support browser:Safari/Chrome)
Note: Action Menu is not depends. And Action Menu is not supported for iOS 9 yet.
